column4: try this and see if it helps-- sudo killall pulseaudio -- see if that fixes it If that does then goto your options for sound and change them to alsa
I have heard of some people depending on a program the pulseaudio trying to kick in to render the sound and stops sound
also look at this page as well SoundTroubleshooting - Community Ubuntu Documentation <https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SoundTroubleshooting>
Should I change the default mixer device to ALSA too?
